name: 辜炳達
objective:
翻譯各式文體風格之文章，賞析名家之譯作，涵括文學、科學、教育、商業等領域作品，並佐以特殊表現法及修辭法之認識及練習。
This course aims at an appreciation of various styles of translated works in such fields as literature, education, science & technology, commerce. so as to equip students with a deep insight into the usage of rhetoric and expression for particular purpose.
schedule:
Week 1: Thinking One’s Way Into Literary Translation 
Week 2: Understanding Translation as an Eco-Poetics 
Week 3: Translation as an Agent of Anthropological/Ethnographic Awareness 
Week 4: Translation and the Re-Conception of Comparative Literature 
Week 5: Translation in Pursuit of an Appropriate Aesthetics 
Week 6: Text and Page: Margin and Rhythm 
Week 7: Translation and Situating the Self: Punctuation and Rhythm 
Week 8: Translation and Vocal Behaviour: Typography and Rhythm 
Week 9: Midterm
Week 10: Translation as Scansion: Capturing the Multiplicity of Rhythm 
Week 11: Identifying an Original
Week 12: Translating the “Unconscious” of Women in Love
Week 13: Translating the Evocative Spirit in James Joyce
Week 14: Translating the Matter of Samuel Beckett’s Manner
Week 15: Barbara Pym and the Untranslatable Commonplace
Week 16: On the Borders of Comprehensibility
Week 17: Translating Individualism: Literature and Globalization
Week 18: Final
materials:
Parks, Tim. Translating style. Routledge, 2007.
Scott, Clive. The Work of Literary Translation. Cambridge UP, 2018.
